H0.text: Rainfall levels could decrease is the most likely result of using pesticides on farm crops.

H1.text: Air temperatures could increase is the most likely result of using pesticides on farm crops.

H2.text: Water sources could become polluted is the most likely result of using pesticides on farm crops.

H3.text: Caterpillars could become extinct as a result of using pesticides on farm crops.

A4.text: Pesticides are one of the causes of water pollution, and some pesticides were persistent organic pollutants (now banned), which contribute to soil and flower (pollen, nectar) contamination.

A5.text: Pesticide use reduces invertebrate biodiversity in streams, contributes to pollinator decline, destroys habitat (especially for birds), and threatens endangered species.

A6.text: Pesticides were found to pollute every stream and over 90% of wells sampled in a study by the US Geological Survey.

A7.text: The use of pesticides decreases the general biodiversity in the soil.
